papers.title: User-Centered Risk Communication for Safer Browsing
papers.authors: Sanchari Das, Jacob Abbott, Shakthidhar Gopavaram, Jim Blythe, L. Jean Camp
papers.abstract: Solutions to phishing have included training users, stand-alone warnings, and automatic blocking. We integrated personalized blocking, filtering, and alerts into a single holistic risk-management tool, which leverages simple metaphorical cartoons that function both as risk communication and controls for browser settings. We tested the tool in two experiments. The first experiment was a four-week naturalistic study where we examined the acceptability and usability of the tool. The experimental group was exposed to fewer risks in that they chose to run fewer scripts, disabled most iFrames, blocked Flash, decreased tracking, and quickly identified each newly encountered website as unfamiliar. Each week participants increased their tool use. Conversely, those in the control group expressed perceptions of lower risk, while enabling more potentially malicious processes. We then tested phishing resilience in the laboratory with newly recruited participants. The results showed that the tool significantly improved participants’ ability to distinguish between legitimate and phishing sites.
papers.abstract_zh: 针对网络钓鱼的解决方案包括培训用户、独立警告和自动阻止。我们将个性化的阻止、过滤和警报集成到一个整体风险管理工具中，该工具利用简单的隐喻漫画，既可以进行风险沟通，也可以控制浏览器设置。我们在两个实验中测试了这个工具。第一个实验是一个为期四周的自然主义研究，我们检查了工具的可接受性和可用性。实验组面临的风险更小，因为他们选择运行更少的脚本，禁用大多数iFrames，阻止Flash，减少跟踪，并迅速将每个新遇到的网站识别为不熟悉的。每个星期，参与者都增加了工具的使用。相反，对照组中的人表达了较低风险的感知，同时允许更多潜在的恶意过程。然后，我们在实验室中用新招募的参与者测试了网络钓鱼弹性。结果显示，该工具显著提高了参与者区分合法网站和钓鱼网站的能力。

papers.title: Load Balancing for Sharded Blockchains
papers.authors: Naoya Okanami, Ryuya Nakamura, Takashi Nishide
papers.abstract: Sharding is an approach to designing a highly scalable blockchain. A sharded blockchain achieves parallelism by dividing consensus nodes (validators) into groups called shards and making them process different transactions in each shard. In this paper, we economically analyze users’ behavior on sharded blockchains and identify a phenomenon that users’ accounts and smart contracts eventually get concentrated in a few shards, making shard loads unfair. This phenomenon leads to bad user experiences, such as delays in transaction inclusions and increased transaction fees. To solve the above problem, we propose a load balancing ramework in sharded blockchains in which accounts and contracts are frequently reassigned into shards to reduce the difference of loads between shards. We formulate the contract reassignment as an optimization problem and present the algorithm to solve it. Further, we apply the framework to an existing sharding design (Ethereum 2.0) and modify the protocol to do load balancing. Finally, we simulate the protocol and observe smaller transaction delays and fees.
papers.abstract_zh: 分片是一种设计高可伸缩区块链的方法。分片区块链通过将共识节点(验证器)分成称为分片的组，并使它们在每个分片中处理不同的事务来实现并行性。在本文中，我们从经济上分析了用户在分片区块链上的行为，并发现了一个现象，即用户的帐户和智能合约最终集中在几个分片中，使得分片负载不公平。这种现象导致了糟糕的用户体验，比如交易包含的延迟和交易费用的增加。为了解决上述问题，我们在分片区块链中提出了一个负载平衡框架，其中账户和合同被频繁地重新分配到分片中，以减少分片之间的负载差异。我们将合同再分配问题公式化为一个优化问题，并给出了求解算法。此外，我们将该框架应用于现有的分片设计(以太坊2.0)，并修改协议以实现负载平衡。最后，我们模拟了该协议，观察到较小的交易延迟和费用。
papers.title_zh: 共享区块链的负载平衡

papers.title: An Empirical Study of Market Inefficiencies in Uniswap and SushiSwap
papers.authors: Jan Arvid Berg, Robin Fritsch, Lioba Heimbach, Roger Wattenhofer
papers.abstract: Decentralized exchanges are revolutionizing finance. With their ever-growing increase in popularity, a natural question that begs to be asked is: how efficient are these new markets? We find that nearly 30% of analyzed trades are executed at an unfavorable rate. Additionally, we observe that, especially during the DeFi summer in 2020, price inaccuracies across the market plagued DEXes. Uniswap and SushiSwap, however, quickly adapt to their increased volumes. We see an increase in market efficiency with time during the observation period. Nonetheless, the DEXes still struggle to track the reference market when cryptocurrency prices are highly volatile. During such periods of high volatility, we observe the market becoming less efficient - manifested by an increased prevalence in cyclic arbitrage opportunities.
papers.title_zh: Uniswap和SushiSwap市场无效性的实证研究
papers.abstract_zh: 分散的交易所正在彻底改变金融。随着它们越来越受欢迎，一个自然的问题是:这些新市场的效率如何？我们发现，近30%的分析交易是以不利的比率执行的。此外，我们观察到，特别是在2020年DeFi夏季期间，整个市场的价格不准确困扰着DEXes。然而，Uniswap和SushiSwap很快适应了它们增加的业务量。在观察期内，我们看到市场效率随着时间的推移而提高。尽管如此，当加密货币价格高度波动时，指数仍难以跟踪参考市场。在这种高波动时期，我们观察到市场变得不那么有效——表现为周期性套利机会的增加。

papers.title: NFT Wash Trading - Quantifying Suspicious Behaviour in NFT Markets
papers.authors: Victor von Wachter, Johannes Rude Jensen, Ferdinand Regner, Omri Ross
papers.abstract: The smart contract-based markets for non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the Ethereum blockchain have seen tremendous growth in 2021, with trading volumes peaking at 3.5b in September 2021. This dramatic surge has led to industry observers questioning the authenticity of on-chain volumes, given the absence of identity requirements and the ease with which agents can control multiple addresses. We examine potentially illicit trading patterns in the NFT markets from January 2018 to mid-November 2021, gathering data from the 52 largest collections by volume. Our findings indicate that within our sample 3.93% of addresses, processing a total of 2.04% of sale transactions, trigger suspicions of market abuse. Flagged transactions contaminate nearly all collections and may have inflated the authentic trading volumes by as much as 149,5m for the period. Most flagged transaction patterns alternate between a few addresses, indicating a predisposition for manual trading. We submit that the results presented here may serve as a viable lower bound estimate for NFT wash trading on Ethereum. Even so, we argue that wash trading may be less common than what industry observers have previously estimated. We contribute to the emerging discourse on the identification and deterrence of market abuse in the cryptocurrency markets.
papers.title_zh: NFT清洗交易-量化NFT市场的可疑行为
papers.abstract_zh: 以太坊区块链交易所基于智能合约的不可替代代币(NFT)市场在2021年取得了巨大的增长，交易量在2021年9月达到35亿英镑的峰值。鉴于缺乏身份要求以及代理商可以轻松控制多个地址，这种戏剧性的激增导致行业观察人士质疑链上交易量的真实性。我们研究了2018年1月至2021年11月中旬NFT市场潜在的非法交易模式，收集了52个最大交易量的数据。我们的研究结果表明，在我们的样本中，3.93%的地址(总共处理了2.04%的销售交易)引发了对市场滥用的怀疑。被标记的交易污染了几乎所有藏品，并可能使该时期的真实交易量增加了多达1.495亿英镑。大多数标记的交易模式在几个地址之间交替，表明有手工交易的倾向。我们认为，这里提出的结果可以作为一个可行的下限估计NFT洗涤以太坊交易。即便如此，我们认为洗盘交易可能没有行业观察人士此前估计的那么普遍。我们致力于在加密货币市场中识别和阻止市场滥用的新兴讨论。

papers.title: Dispute-Free Scalable Open Vote Network Using zk-SNARKs
papers.authors: Muhammad ElSheikh, Amr M. Youssef
papers.abstract: The Open Vote Network is a self-tallying decentralized evoting protocol suitable for boardroom elections. Currently, it has two Ethereum-based implementations: the first, by McCorry et al., has a scalability issue since all the computations are performed on-chain. The second implementation, by Seifelnasr et al., solves this issue partially by assigning a part of the heavy computations to an off-chain untrusted administrator in a verifiable manner. As a side effect, this second implementation became not dispute-free; there is a need for a tally dispute phase where an observer interrupts the protocol when the administrator cheats, i.e., announces a wrong tally result. In this work, we propose a new smart contract design to tackle the problems in the previous implementations by (i) preforming all the heavy computations off-chain hence achieving higher scalability, and (ii) utilizing zero-knowledge Succinct Non-interactive Argument of Knowledge (zk-SNARK) to verify the correctness of the off-chain computations, hence maintaining the disputefree property. To demonstrate the effectiveness of our design, we develop prototype implementations on Ethereum and conduct multiple experiments for different implementation options that show a trade-off between the zk-SNARK proof generation time and the smart contract gas cost, including an implementation in which the smart contract consumes a constant amount of gas independent of the number of voters.
papers.title_zh: 使用zk-SNARKs的无争议可扩展公开投票网络
papers.abstract_zh: 开放投票网络是一种适合于董事会选举的自我计数的分散式选举协议。目前，它有两个基于以太坊的实现:第一个是由McCorry等人实现的，有一个可伸缩性问题，因为所有的计算都是在链上执行的。Seifelnasr等人的第二个实现通过以可验证的方式将一部分繁重的计算分配给链外的不可信管理员，部分地解决了这个问题。作为副作用，这第二个实现变得没有争议；需要一个计票争议阶段，其中当管理员作弊，即宣布错误的计票结果时，观察者中断协议。在这项工作中，我们提出了一种新的智能契约设计，通过(I)离线执行所有繁重的计算，从而实现更高的可扩展性，以及(ii)利用零知识简洁的非交互式知识论证(zk-SNARK)来验证离线计算的正确性，从而保持无争议属性，来解决以前实现中的问题。为了证明我们的设计的有效性，我们在以太坊上开发了原型实现，并对不同的实现选项进行了多次实验，这些实验显示了zk-SNARK证明生成时间和智能合同气体成本之间的权衡，包括智能合同消耗恒定量气体而与投票者数量无关的实现。

papers.title: Not so Immutable: Upgradeability of Smart Contracts on Ethereum
papers.authors: Mehdi Salehi, Jeremy Clark, Mohammad Mannan
papers.abstract: A smart contract that is deployed to a blockchain system like Ethereum is, under reasonable circumstances, expected to be immutable and tamper-proof. This is both a feature (promoting integrity and transparency) and a bug (preventing security patches and feature updates). Modern smart contracts use software tricks to enable upgradeability, raising the research questions of how upgradeability is achieved and who is authorized to make changes. In this paper, we summarize and evaluate six upgradeability patterns. We develop a measurement framework for finding how many upgradeable contracts are on Ethereum that use certain prominent upgrade patters. We find 1.4 million proxy contracts which 8,225 of them are unique upgradeable proxy contracts. We also measure how they implement access control over their upgradeability: about 50% are controlled by a single Externally Owned Address (EOA), and about 14% are controlled by multi-signature wallets in which a limited number of persons can change the whole logic of the contract.
papers.title_zh: 并非如此不可改变:以太坊智能合约的可升级性
papers.abstract_zh: 在合理的情况下，部署到以太坊这样的区块链系统的智能合约应该是不可变的和防篡改的。这既是一个特性(促进完整性和透明性)，也是一个bug(阻止安全补丁和特性更新)。现代智能合约使用软件技巧来实现可升级性，提出了如何实现可升级性以及谁有权进行更改的研究问题。在本文中，我们总结并评估了六种可升级模式。我们开发了一个测量框架来发现以太坊上有多少可升级的合同使用了某些显著的升级模式。我们发现了140万份代理合同，其中8，225份是独特的可升级代理合同。我们还衡量他们如何对其可升级性实施访问控制:约50%由单个外部拥有的地址(EOA)控制，约14%由多签名钱包控制，其中有限数量的人可以改变合同的整个逻辑。

papers.title: Distributed and Adversarial Resistant Workflow Execution on the Algorand Blockchain
papers.authors: Yibin Xu, Tijs Slaats, Boris Düdder, Søren Debois, Haiqin Wu
papers.abstract: . We provide a practical translation from the Dynamic Condition Response (DCR) process modelling language to the Transaction Execution Approval Language (TEAL) used by the Algorand blockchain. Compared to earlier implementations of business process notations on blockchains, particularly Ethereum, the present implementation is four orders of magnitude cheaper. This translation has the following immedi-ate ramiﬁcations: (1) It allows decentralised execution of DCR-speciﬁed business processes in the absence of expensive intermediaries (lawyers, brokers) or counterparty risk. (2) It provides a possibly helpful high-level language for implementing business processes on Algorand. (3) It demonstrates that despite the strict limitations on Algorand smart contracts, they are powerful enough to encode models of a modern process notation.
papers.title_zh: 在Algorand区块链上分布式和对抗性工作流执行
papers.abstract_zh: 。我们提供了从动态条件响应(DCR)流程建模语言到阿尔格兰德区块链公司使用的交易执行批准语言(TEAL)的实际翻译。与区块链上业务流程符号的早期实现相比，特别是以太坊，目前的实现便宜了四个数量级。这种转换具有以下直接影响:(1)它允许在没有昂贵的中介(律师、经纪人)或交易对手风险的情况下，分散执行DCR特定的业务流程。(2)它为在Algorand上实现业务流程提供了一种可能有用的高级语言。(3)它表明，尽管Algorand智能合约有严格的限制，但它们足够强大，可以对现代过程符号的模型进行编码。

papers.title: A Scalable Architecture for Electronic Payments
papers.authors: Geoffrey Goodell, D. R. Toliver, Hazem Danny Al-Nakib
papers.abstract: We present a scalable architecture for electronic retail payments via central bank digital currency and oﬀer a solution to the perceived conﬂict between robust regulatory oversight and consumer aﬀordances such as privacy and control. Our architecture combines existing work in payment systems and digital currency with a new approach to digital asset design for managing unforgeable, stateful, and oblivious assets without relying on either a central authority or a monolithic consensus system. Regulated ﬁnancial institutions have a role in every transaction, and the consumer aﬀordances are achieved through the use of non-custodial wallets that unlink the sender from the recipient in the transaction channel. This approach is fully compatible with the existing two-tiered banking system and can complement and extend the roles of existing money services businesses and asset custodians.
papers.title_zh: 用于电子支付的可扩展架构
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一种通过中央银行数字货币和oﬀer进行电子零售支付的可扩展架构，这是一种解决稳健监管和消费者aﬀordances(如隐私和控制)之间冲突的解决方案。我们的架构将支付系统和数字货币方面的现有工作与数字资产设计的新方法相结合，用于管理不可伪造、有状态和遗忘的资产，而不依赖于中央权威机构或单一共识系统。受监管的金融机构在每笔交易中都发挥着作用，而消费者aﬀordances是通过使用非托管钱包来实现的，非托管钱包在交易渠道中将发送者与接收者分开。这种方法与现有的两级银行体系完全兼容，可以补充和扩展现有货币服务企业和资产托管人的作用。

papers.title: Decentralisation Conscious Players and System Reliability
papers.authors: Sarah Azouvi, Alexander Hicks
papers.abstract: . We propose a game-theoretic model of the reliability of decentralised systems based on Varian’s model of system reliability [27], to which we add a new normalised total eﬀort case that models decentralisation conscious players who prioritise decentralisation. We derive the Nash equilibria in the normalised total eﬀort game. In these equilibria, either one or two values are played by players that do not free ride. The speed at which players can adjust their contributions can determine how an equilibrium is reached and equilibrium values. The behaviour of decentralisation conscious players is robust to deviations by other players. Our results highlight the role that decentralisation conscious players can play in maintaining decentralisation. They also highlight, however, that by supporting an equilibrium that requires an important contribution they cannot be expected to increase decentralisation as contributing the equilibrium value may still imply a loss for many players. We also discuss practical constraints on decentralisation in the context of our model.
papers.abstract_zh: 。我们在瓦里安系统可靠性模型[27]的基础上提出了一个分散系统可靠性的博弈论模型，在此基础上我们添加了一个新的标准化总eﬀort案例，该案例模拟了优先考虑分散的分散意识参与者。我们得到了规范的全eﬀort博弈中的纳什均衡。在这些均衡中，不搭便车的玩家会选择一个或两个值。玩家可以调整其贡献的速度可以决定如何达到均衡以及均衡值。有分散意识的玩家的行为对于其他玩家的偏离是稳健的。我们的结果强调了去中心化意识的玩家在保持去中心化中的作用。然而，他们也强调，通过支持一个需要重要贡献的均衡，他们不能被期望增加分散化，因为贡献均衡价值可能仍然意味着许多参与者的损失。我们还讨论了在我们的模型背景下分散化的实际限制。
papers.title_zh: 有分散意识的玩家和系统可靠性

papers.title: Achieving Almost All Blockchain Functionalities with Polylogarithmic Storage
papers.authors: Parikshit Hegde, Robert Streit, Yanni Georghiades, Chaya Ganesh, Sriram Vishwanath
papers.abstract: . In current blockchain systems, full nodes that perform all of the available functionalities need to store the entire blockchain. In addition to the blockchain, full nodes also store a blockchain-summary, called the state , which is used to eﬃciently verify transactions. With the size of popular blockchains and their states growing rapidly, full nodes require massive storage resources in order to keep up with the scaling. This leads to a tug-of-war between scaling and decentralization since fewer entities can aﬀord expensive resources. We present hybrid nodes for proof-of-work (PoW) cryptocurrencies which can validate transactions, validate blocks, validate states, mine, select the main chain, bootstrap new hybrid nodes, and verify payment proofs. With the use of a protocol called trimming , hybrid nodes only retain polylogarithmic number of blocks in the chain length in order to represent the proof-of-work of the blockchain. Hybrid nodes are also optimized for the storage of the state with the use of stateless blockchain protocols. The lowered storage requirements should enable more entities to join as hybrid nodes and improve the decentralization of the system. We deﬁne novel theoretical security models for hybrid nodes and show that they are provably secure. We also show that the storage requirement of hybrid nodes is near-optimal with respect to our security deﬁnitions.
papers.abstract_zh: 。在当前的区块链系统中，执行所有可用功能的完整节点需要存储整个区块链。除了区块链，完整节点还存储一个称为状态的区块链摘要，用于对事务进行eﬃciently验证。随着流行的区块链及其所在州的规模快速增长，完整节点需要大量存储资源才能跟上规模的增长。这导致了扩展和去中心化之间的拉锯战，因为较少的实体可以aﬀord昂贵的资源。我们提出了工作证明(PoW)加密货币的混合节点，可以验证交易、验证块、验证状态、挖掘、选择主链、引导新的混合节点以及验证支付证明。通过使用名为trimming的协议，混合节点仅保留链长度中的多对数块数，以表示区块链的工作证明。混合节点还通过使用无状态区块链协议针对状态存储进行了优化。降低的存储需求将使更多的实体能够作为混合节点加入，并提高系统的分散性。我们为混合节点定义了新的理论安全模型，并证明它们是可证明安全的。我们还表明，就我们的安全定义而言，混合节点的存储要求接近最优。
papers.title_zh: 利用多对数存储实现几乎所有的区块链功能

papers.title: Fast Isomorphic State Channels
papers.authors: Manuel M. T. Chakravarty, Sandro Coretti, Matthias Fitzi, Peter Gazi, Philipp Kant, Aggelos Kiayias, Alexander Russell
papers.abstract: State channels are an attractive layer-two solution for improving the throughput and latency of blockchains. They offer optimistic fast offchain settlement of payments and rapid offchain evolution of smart contracts between multiple parties without imposing any additional assumptions beyond those of the underlying blockchain. In the case of disputes, or if a party fails to respond, cryptographic evidence collected in the offchain channel is used to settle the last confirmed state onchain, such that in-progress contracts can be continued under mainchain consensus. A serious disadvantage present in current layer-two state channel protocols is that existing layer-one smart contract infrastructure and contract code cannot be reused offchain without change. In this paper, we introduce Hydra, an isomorphic multi-party state channel. Hydra simplifies offchain protocol and contract development by directly adopting the layer-one smart contract system. We present the onchain contracts to open and close Hydra heads (our isomorphic state channels) and a novel offchain protocol for fast evolution of heads. We establish strong security properties for the protocol, and we present and evaluate extensive simulation results that demonstrate that Hydra approaches the physical limits of the network in terms of transaction confirmation time and throughput while keeping storage requirements at the lowest possible.
papers.abstract_zh: 状态通道是一种有吸引力的第二层解决方案，用于提高区块链的吞吐量和延迟。它们提供乐观的快速支付链外结算和多方之间智能合约的快速链外演变，而不强加任何超出基础区块链的额外假设。在有争议的情况下，或者如果一方未能响应，则在链外通道中收集的加密证据被用于解决链上的最后确认状态，使得正在进行的合同可以在主链共识下继续。当前第二层状态信道协议中存在的一个严重缺点是，现有的第一层智能合同基础设施和合同代码不能不加改变地离线重用。在本文中，我们介绍了Hydra，一个同构的多方国家渠道。Hydra通过直接采用第一层智能合同系统简化了链外协议和合同开发。我们提出了打开和关闭Hydra头(我们的同构状态通道)的onchain契约和一个新颖的头快速进化的offchain协议。我们为该协议建立了强大的安全属性，并提供和评估了大量的模拟结果，这些结果表明Hydra在事务确认时间和吞吐量方面接近网络的物理极限，同时将存储需求保持在尽可能低的水平。
papers.title_zh: 快速同构状态通道

papers.abstract:
Exchanges and other trading venues must be able to reliably offer sufficient liquidity to meet traders' demand, and, in turn, benefit from higher revenue and faster growth. Traders enjoy lower volatility, tighter spreads, and more efficient pricing in liquid markets. A key problem for exchanges is how to attract liquidity providers and retain their support in all market conditions. This is commonly approached through individual business agreements with market makers whereby a bespoke contract is negotiated for specific obligations and rewards. Such approaches require a central intermediary that profits from liquidity provision to administer, and typically fail to align the incentives of exchanges and liquidity providers as markets grow. This is costly, slow, and scalability is limited by the exchange’s resources, contacts, and expertise. 
 
This paper develops mechanisms for creating open, automated and scalable liquidity markets. We describe formal methods to quantify liquidity and discuss various approaches to determine its price. In so doing, we introduce a novel way to structure liquidity commitments, along with a mechanism based on a financial bond with penalties for under-provision to maximize market makers’ adherence to their obligations. We also investigate mechanisms to allocate rewards derived from trading fees between market makers, so as to incentivise desirable-but-risky behaviors such as market creation and early commitment of liquidity. We complement this work with several agent based simulations exploring the proposed mechanisms.
papers.abstract_zh:
交易所和其他交易场所必须能够可靠地提供足够的流动性来满足交易者的需求，并反过来从更高的收入和更快的增长中受益。在流动性市场中，交易者享受更低的波动性、更小的利差和更有效的定价。交易所的一个关键问题是如何吸引流动性提供者，并在所有市场条件下保持他们的支持。这通常是通过与做市商的个别业务协议来实现的，根据这些协议，就特定的义务和回报协商定制合同。这种方法需要一个从流动性供应中获利的中央中介来管理，并且通常无法随着市场增长协调交易所和流动性提供者的激励。这种方法成本高、速度慢，而且可扩展性受到exchange的资源、联系人和专业技能的限制。

本文开发了创建开放、自动化和可扩展的流动性市场的机制。我们描述了量化流动性的正式方法，并讨论了确定其价格的各种方法。为此，我们引入了一种构建流动性承诺的新方法，以及一种基于金融债券的机制，该机制对拨备不足进行处罚，以最大限度地提高做市商对其义务的遵守程度。我们还研究了在做市商之间分配来自交易费用的奖励的机制，以激励理想但有风险的行为，如创造市场和流动性的早期承诺。我们用几个基于代理的模拟来补充这项工作，探索提出的机制。

papers.title: Short Paper: Addressing Sophisticated Email Attacks
papers.authors: Markus Jakobsson
papers.abstract: We argue that as email attacks continue to increase in sophistication, error rates and filter processing times are both likely to increase. We address the problem at its root by introducing the notion of open quarantine, an approach that avoids tradeo s between filtering precision and delivery delays. This is achieved using a multi-phase filtering approach, combined with the neutralization of messages with undetermined security posture.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们认为，随着电子邮件攻击的复杂性不断增加，错误率和过滤处理时间都可能增加。我们通过引入开放隔离的概念来从根本上解决问题，这种方法避免了过滤精度和交付延迟之间的折衷。这是通过使用多阶段过滤方法，并结合具有不确定安全状态的消息的中和来实现的。

papers.title: Confidential Assets
papers.authors: Andrew Poelstra, Adam Back, Mark Friedenbach, Gregory Maxwell, Pieter Wuille
papers.abstract: In privacy-preserving transaction protocols, confidential asset designs permit transfer of quantities of distinct asset types in a way that obscures their types and values. Spark is a protocol that provides flexible privacy properties relating to addressing, transaction sources and recipients, and value transfer; however, it does not natively support the use of multiple confidential asset types. Here we describe Spats, a new design for confidential assets compatible with Spark that focuses on efficient and modular implementation. It does so by extending coin value commitments to bind and mask an asset type, and asserting in zero knowledge that this type is maintained throughout transactions. We describe the cryptographic components and changes to the Spark protocol necessary for the design of Spats.
papers.abstract_zh: 在保护隐私的交易协议中，机密资产设计允许以掩盖其类型和价值的方式转移大量不同类型的资产。Spark是一种协议，它提供了与寻址、交易源和接收者以及价值转移相关的灵活的隐私属性；但是，它本身不支持多种机密资产类型的使用。在这里，我们描述Spats，这是一种与Spark兼容的机密资产的新设计，专注于高效和模块化的实现。它通过扩展硬币价值承诺来绑定和掩盖一种资产类型，并在零知识的情况下断言这种类型在整个交易中得到维护。我们描述了Spats设计所需的加密组件和对Spark协议的更改。

papers.title: Computer-Supported Cooperative Crime
papers.authors: Vaibhav Garg, Sadia Afroz, Rebekah Overdorf, Rachel Greenstadt
papers.abstract: Spatial analysis plays a key role in crime prevention. Traditional approaches such as clustering can find static patterns but do not consider the change of spatial patterns over time. In this paper, we introduce a new analysis framework, dynamic pattern analysis framework (DPA framework) focusing on two types of related dynamic patterns: the displacement or diffusion of spatial patterns over time and the similarity between spatial patterns of different periods. The new framework aims to support cooperative crime prevention in a district of Hong Kong.
papers.abstract_zh: 空间分析在预防犯罪中发挥着关键作用。聚类等传统方法可以发现静态模式，但没有考虑空间模式随时间的变化。本文介绍了一个新的分析框架——动态格局分析框架(DPA framework)，该框架主要关注两类相关的动态格局:空间格局随时间的位移或扩散以及不同时期空间格局之间的相似性。新框架旨在支持香港某区的合作预防犯罪。
